results.title: Magic in the air
results.brief_description: A simple explanation with animated diagrams shows the basic principles of television. This film takes you behind the scenes of television studios at Radio City, the construction of the iconoscope which is the sender and the kinescope which is the receiver.
results.description: A simple explanation with animated diagrams shows the basic principles of television. This film takes you behind the scenes of television studios at Radio City, the construction of the iconoscope which is the sender and the kinescope which is the receiver.

results.title: Magic Flute
results.creator_credit: Gayle Thomas, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Lyrical animation of the magical events which occur when various children play a flute, evoking both pleasant scenes of flowers and unpleasant ones of witches and bats, according to the personality of the child. Sound film without words. (Awards: Palo Alto; Columbus)

results.title: Magic fibre
results.creator_credit: Bruce McNaughton, Australian Wool Corporation and Aranda Films
results.brief_description: Wool from the sheep’s back to the finished market product. Shows shearing, sorting, testing, classifying, buyers, cleaning, carding, spinning, knitting and weaving. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Magic canvas
results.brief_description: An experiment in the use of the animated cartoon as a new art medium employing to best advantage movement, color and music to convey the ideas of the artists. No narration, music only.

results.title: Maggie Mcgowan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Your life in their hands”.
Part of series of medical films produced at a London hospital. The camera follows the surgeons operating on Mrs. McGowan as they introduce remarkable techniques in modern medicine to save her from cancer of the bowel.

results.title: Maggie Kuhn: wrinkled radical
results.creator_credit: Howard Weinberg and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: Maggie Kuhn who helped establish the Gray Panter Movement in America discusses aspects of old age, human sexuality and medical care. Interviewed by Studs Terkel.

results.title: Magdalena Abakanowicz workshop, Cell Block Theatre, Sydney
results.creator_credit: Christopher McGill, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: At her four day workshop in Sydney’s Cell Block Theatre in 1976, Magdalena tries to draw the students’ attention to problems like shape, scale, tension between forms space and light. The workshop is shown in progress in four stages of development. Narration by Anne Haddy.
results.title_for_label: Magdalena Abakanowicz workshop, Cell Block Theatre, Sydney

results.title: Maestro
results.creator_credit: Mark Hughes, Martin Didsbury and Open Training and Education Network
results.brief_description: Presented by Andrea Stretton of SBS’s “The Book Show”, this video features dramatised excerpts from the novel, “Maestro”, and studio discussions with it’s author (Peter Goldsworthy) and an English teacher. Together, they explore the importance of personal response to the novel, how to establish a personal response, and how to give the ensuing personal response.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Hughes, Martin Didsbury and Open Training and Education Network
